24  package com.dd.plist;
25  
26  import java.io.IOException;
27  
28  /**
29   * A number whose value is either an integer, a real number or boolean.
30   *
31   * @author Daniel Dreibrodt
32   */
33  public class NSNumber extends NSObject implements Comparable<Object> {
34  
35      /**
36       * Indicates that the number's value is an integer.
37       * The number is stored as a Java <code>long</code>.
38       * Its original value could have been char, short, int, long or even long long.
39       */
40      public static final int INTEGER = 0;
41  
42      /**
43       * Indicates that the number's value is a real number.
44       * The number is stored as a Java <code>double</code>.
45       * Its original value could have been float or double.
46       */
47      public static final int REAL = 1;
48  
49      /**
50       * Indicates that the number's value is boolean.
51       */
52      public static final int BOOLEAN = 2;
53  
54      //Holds the current type of this number
55      private int type;
56  
57      private long longValue;
58      private double doubleValue;
59      private boolean boolValue;
60  
61      /**
62       * Parses integers and real numbers from their binary representation.
63       * <i>Note: real numbers are not yet supported.</i>
64       *
65       * @param bytes The binary representation
66       * @param type  The type of number
67       * @see #INTEGER
68       * @see #REAL
69       */
70      public NSNumber(byte[] bytes, int type) {
71          switch (type) {
72              case INTEGER: {
73                  doubleValue = longValue = BinaryPropertyListParser.parseLong(bytes);
74                  break;
75              }
76              case REAL: {
77                  doubleValue = BinaryPropertyListParser.parseDouble(bytes);
78                  longValue = Math.round(doubleValue);
79                  break;
80              }
81              default: {
82                  throw new IllegalArgumentException("Type argument is not valid.");
83              }
84          }
85          this.type = type;
86      }
87  
88      /**
89       * Creates a number from its textual representation.
90       *
91       * @param text The textual representation of the number.
92       * @throws IllegalArgumentException If the text does not represent an integer, real number or boolean value.
93       * @see Boolean#parseBoolean(java.lang.String)
94       * @see Long#parseLong(java.lang.String)
95       * @see Double#parseDouble(java.lang.String)
96       */
97      public NSNumber(String text) {
98          if (text == null)
99              throw new IllegalArgumentException("The given string is null and cannot be parsed as number.");
100         try {
101             long l = Long.parseLong(text);
102             doubleValue = longValue = l;
103             type = INTEGER;
104         } catch (Exception ex) {
105             try {
106                 doubleValue = Double.parseDouble(text);
107                 longValue = Math.round(doubleValue);
108                 type = REAL;
109             } catch (Exception ex2) {
110                 try {
111                     boolValue = text.toLowerCase().equals("true") || text.toLowerCase().equals("yes");
112                     if(!boolValue && !(text.toLowerCase().equals("false") || text.toLowerCase().equals("no"))) {
113                         throw new Exception("not a boolean");
114                     }
115                     type = BOOLEAN;
116                     doubleValue = longValue = boolValue ? 1 : 0;
117                 } catch (Exception ex3) {
118                     throw new IllegalArgumentException("The given string neither represents a double, an int nor a boolean value.");
119                 }
120             }
121         }
122     }
123 
124     /**
125      * Creates an integer number.
126      *
127      * @param i The integer value.
128      */
129     public NSNumber(int i) {
130         doubleValue = longValue = i;
131         type = INTEGER;
132     }
133 
134     /**
135      * Creates an integer number.
136      *
137      * @param l The long integer value.
138      */
139     public NSNumber(long l) {
140         doubleValue = longValue = l;
141         type = INTEGER;
142     }
143 
144     /**
145      * Creates a real number.
146      *
147      * @param d The real value.
148      */
149     public NSNumber(double d) {
150         longValue = (long) (doubleValue = d);
151         type = REAL;
152     }
153 
154     /**
155      * Creates a boolean number.
156      *
157      * @param b The boolean value.
158      */
159     public NSNumber(boolean b) {
160         boolValue = b;
161         doubleValue = longValue = b ? 1 : 0;
162         type = BOOLEAN;
163     }
164 
165     /**
166      * Gets the type of this number's value.
167      *
168      * @return The type flag.
169      * @see #BOOLEAN
170      * @see #INTEGER
171      * @see #REAL
172      */
173     public int type() {
174         return type;
175     }
176 
177     /**
178      * Checks whether the value of this NSNumber is a boolean.
179      *
180      * @return Whether the number's value is a boolean.
181      */
182     public boolean isBoolean() {
183         return type == BOOLEAN;
184     }
185 
186     /**
187      * Checks whether the value of this NSNumber is an integer.
188      *
189      * @return Whether the number's value is an integer.
190      */
191     public boolean isInteger() {
192         return type == INTEGER;
193     }
194 
195     /**
196      * Checks whether the value of this NSNumber is a real number.
197      *
198      * @return Whether the number's value is a real number.
199      */
200     public boolean isReal() {
201         return type == REAL;
202     }
203 
204     /**
205      * The number's boolean value.
206      *
207      * @return <code>true</code> if the value is true or non-zero, false</code> otherwise.
208      */
209     public boolean boolValue() {
210         if (type == BOOLEAN)
211             return boolValue;
212         else
213             return longValue != 0;
214     }
215 
216     /**
217      * The number's long value.
218      *
219      * @return The value of the number as long
220      */
221     public long longValue() {
222         return longValue;
223     }
224 
225     /**
226      * The number's int value.
227      * <i>Note: Even though the number's type might be INTEGER it can be larger than a Java int.
228      * Use intValue() only if you are certain that it contains a number from the int range.
229      * Otherwise the value might be innaccurate.</i>
230      *
231      * @return The value of the number as int
232      */
233     public int intValue() {
234         return (int) longValue;
235     }
236 
237     /**
238      * The number's double value.
239      *
240      * @return The value of the number as double.
241      */
242     public double doubleValue() {
243         return doubleValue;
244     }
245 
246     /**
247      * The number's float value.
248      * WARNING: Possible loss of precision if the value is outside the float range.
249      *
250      * @return The value of the number as float.
251      */
252     public float floatValue() {
253         return (float) doubleValue;
254     }
255 
256     /**
257      * Checks whether the other object is a NSNumber of the same value.
258      *
259      * @param obj The object to compare to.
260      * @return Whether the objects are equal in terms of numeric value and type.
261      */
262     @Override
263     public boolean equals(Object obj) {
264         if (!(obj instanceof NSNumber)) return false;
265         NSNumber n = (NSNumber) obj;
266         return type == n.type && longValue == n.longValue && doubleValue == n.doubleValue && boolValue == n.boolValue;
267     }
268 
269     @Override
270     public int hashCode() {
271         int hash = type;
272         hash = 37 * hash + (int) (this.longValue ^ (this.longValue >>> 32));
273         hash = 37 * hash + (int) (Double.doubleToLongBits(this.doubleValue) ^ (Double.doubleToLongBits(this.doubleValue) >>> 32));
274         hash = 37 * hash + (boolValue() ? 1 : 0);
275         return hash;
276     }
277 
278 
279     @Override
280     public String toString() {
281         switch (type) {
282             case INTEGER: {
283                 return String.valueOf(longValue());
284             }
285             case REAL: {
286                 return String.valueOf(doubleValue());
287             }
288             case BOOLEAN: {
289                 return String.valueOf(boolValue());
290             }
291             default: {
292                 return super.toString();
293             }
294         }
295     }
296 
297     @Override
298     void toXML(StringBuilder xml, int level) {
299         indent(xml, level);
300         switch (type) {
301             case INTEGER: {
302                 xml.append("<integer>");
303                 xml.append(longValue());
304                 xml.append("</integer>");
305                 break;
306             }
307             case REAL: {
308                 xml.append("<real>");
309                 xml.append(doubleValue());
310                 xml.append("</real>");
311                 break;
312             }
313             case BOOLEAN: {
314                 if (boolValue())
315                     xml.append("<true/>");
316                 else
317                     xml.append("<false/>");
318                 break;
319             }
320         }
321     }
322 
323     @Override
324     void toBinary(BinaryPropertyListWriter out) throws IOException {
325         switch (type()) {
326             case INTEGER: {
327                 if (longValue() < 0) {
328                     out.write(0x13);
329                     out.writeBytes(longValue(), 8);
330                 } else if (longValue() <= 0xff) {
331                     out.write(0x10);
332                     out.writeBytes(longValue(), 1);
333                 } else if (longValue() <= 0xffff) {
334                     out.write(0x11);
335                     out.writeBytes(longValue(), 2);
336                 } else if (longValue() <= 0xffffffffL) {
337                     out.write(0x12);
338                     out.writeBytes(longValue(), 4);
339                 } else {
340                     out.write(0x13);
341                     out.writeBytes(longValue(), 8);
342                 }
343                 break;
344             }
345             case REAL: {
346                 out.write(0x23);
347                 out.writeDouble(doubleValue());
348                 break;
349             }
350             case BOOLEAN: {
351                 out.write(boolValue() ? 0x09 : 0x08);
352                 break;
353             }
354         }
355     }
356 
357     @Override
358     protected void toASCII(StringBuilder ascii, int level) {
359         indent(ascii, level);
360         if (type == BOOLEAN) {
361             ascii.append(boolValue ? "YES" : "NO");
362         } else {
363             ascii.append(toString());
364         }
365     }
366 
367     @Override
368     protected void toASCIIGnuStep(StringBuilder ascii, int level) {
369         indent(ascii, level);
370         switch (type) {
371             case INTEGER: {
372                 ascii.append("<*I");
373                 ascii.append(toString());
374                 ascii.append(">");
375                 break;
376             }
377             case REAL: {
378                 ascii.append("<*R");
379                 ascii.append(toString());
380                 ascii.append(">");
381                 break;
382             }
383             case BOOLEAN: {
384                 if (boolValue) {
385                     ascii.append("<*BY>");
386                 } else {
387                     ascii.append("<*BN>");
388                 }
389             }
390         }
391     }
392 
393     public int compareTo(Object o) {
394         double x = doubleValue();
395         double y;
396         if (o instanceof NSNumber) {
397             NSNumber num = (NSNumber) o;
398             y = num.doubleValue();
399             return (x < y) ? -1 : ((x == y) ? 0 : 1);
400         } else if (o instanceof Number) {
401             y = ((Number) o).doubleValue();
402             return (x < y) ? -1 : ((x == y) ? 0 : 1);
403         } else {
404             return -1;
405         }
406     }
407 }
